definition:
The Mittag-Leffler function $E_{\alpha \beta}$ is a complex function
which depends on two complex parameters $\alpha$ and $\beta$. It may be
defined by the following series when the real part of $\alpha$ is
strictly positive:
$$E_{\alpha \beta} (z) = \sum_{k=0}^\infty {z^k \over \Gamma (\alpha k + \beta)}$$
In this case, the series converges for all values of the argument $z$,
so the Mittag-Leffler function is an entire function.
